data.name: Apple Mint
data.description: The mint family is well known for aiding digestion and calming effects. Flavors of light, fresh mint-crisp with a natural sweetness.

style.name: Dry Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a dry white wine, with a pleasant mixture of subtle honey character, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Starrlight Mead
breweries.description:
After several years as home mead makers, we are thrilled to be opening Starrlight Mead. We have had a fantastic time making mead and meeting mead drinkers from all over the world, and now its our turn to share our love of mead with all of you!

Becky Starr, Owner, Sales/Tasting Room Manager
Ben Starr, Owner, Wine/Meadmaker

We first discovered mead in CA at the Southern California Renaissance Pleasure Faire. Several years later, we found friends that were home brewing mead with good results. We decided to try our hand at it too.

In February 2006, we entered our first competition and took Best in Show out of over 210 entries in the home mead-maker category at the International Mead Association’s Mead Festival. The competition was judged by seven professionals in the mead industry; including Ken Schramm, author of The Compleat Mead Maker, and meadery owners from around the world. The Best in Show prize was selected from the gold medal winners in nine categories. Our “Starrlight Mulled Apple Cyser” was awarded not only the gold medal in the cyser (mead made with apples) category, but was also selected as the best overall representation of mead making. It was at that point we decided to try creating a business from our love of mead.

Ben shares his expertise and love of brewing by conducting demonstrations and workshops on mead making in the local community. We also organize and conduct the local Mead Day celebration each August (since 2005) and are a key part of the product tasting team for mead reviews on Gotmead.com. Becky worked with Chatham Hill Winery for 2 years learning tasting room and wine club management. We are members of the Chatham County Beekeepers Association, and the NC Winegrowers Association.

Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: B. Nektar Meadery
breweries.description:
Known for the most amazing and creative alcoholic beverages made from honey. B. Nektar is a world-wide sensation.

To boldly go where no meadery has gone before. To prove to you that the horrible mead your best friend made one time in college is NOT what a good mead should taste like. To show you that mead doesn't HAVE to be sweet. To educate you on the different styles of mead. To bring mead into the mainstream, but still maintain our integrity. To everyday thank my mom and tell her that I love her (shouldn't we all?).

breweries.name: Mad Beach Craft Brewing Company
breweries.description: Setting itself as the premiere craft brewing company on the beach, Madeira Beach Craft Brewing Company (MBCBC) manufactures a whole host of craft brews from IPAs to Ales to seasonal specialties.  With an opening set for the fall of 2013, MBCBC is sure to leave a lasting impression on your vacation!

data.description: Our Blackberry Mead is sweet, tangy and bursting with flavor! Serve chilled with beef or pork. Or try it with a lemon flavored dessert or as a reduction over pound cake!

data.name: Blackberry Off-Dry Mead
data.description: Our limited release Blackberry Off-dry Mead is our honey homage to red wine. With a full berry nose, and a taste that is tart blackberry balanced with the warm flavors of oak and vanilla, this luscious gem is the perfect complement to a romantic evening. Serve at cellar temperature with beef or pork, or chill slightly, if you prefer.

data.name: Embrace
data.description:
Rich with blackcurrant notes that last long into the finish, considered dry to semi-sweet.  It will pair well with cheese, dark chocolate, red meats, and a wide variety of dishes.  Deep tart finish that is clean and flavorful.  As we say there's nothing like a wonderful EMBRACE.

Gold Medal winner at the 2015 Mazer Cup International

style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a dry white wine, with a pleasant mixture of subtle honey character, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Moonlight Meadery
breweries.description:
It all started back in 1995, when Michael tried a cyser (apple and honey mead) for the first time.  Since that first sip Michael has developed a passion, and a masterful skill at making international award winning meads. Michael Fairbrother has started Moonlight Meadery™, with a mission to bring ultra premium meads to the market place.  It is more than a product and it is more than a process, it's our obsession.

"Mead to me is passion, it's about living and love, it's about enjoyment, family and friends, and sharing." says Michael Fairbrother, Founder and Mead Maker. 

Our meads will be unique, and unlike anything you have ever tried, you will find it incredible!   We are going to embrace the unique nature of natural honey as minimally processed as possible.

data.name: Episode 13
data.description: It’s a dark time for the rebel army. The evil empire has tightened its grip and has silenced the rebels’ voice. In an effort to strengthen their cause, the rebels sent out thousands of bottles across the galaxy. But the Imperial troops are hot on their trail. The revolution begins today. Help us B. Nektar fans... You’re our only hope. May the pours be with you.

breweries.name: Blue Dog Mead
breweries.description:
The oldest beverage on earth just got a facelift. No longer are viking wannabes and medieval enthusiasts the only people who get to knock back a glass of the original liquid sin. Now it’s your turn.

Mead has been around longer than any other drink on the planet, so we’ve had plenty of time to perfect the recipe. Blue Dog Mead is concocted with honey instead of grapes, making it a sweet, refreshing alternative to wine. Not to toot our own horn, but we think with one sip you’ll be hooked.

Our newly designed bottles are made to move, and we don’t just mean off
the shelves. We mean to the beach,in a backpack or while watching a game. You’re mobile and active, so why shouldn’t your drink be? No gimmicks here. Blue Dog just wants to go with you as you grab the 
leash and take life for a good long walk.

So leave history to the vikings and the books, grab yourself some Blue Dog Mead and let’s explore the future of this brand spankin’ old drink together.

style.name: Dry Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a dry white wine, with a pleasant mixture of subtle honey character, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

data.name: Honey Oak
data.description: We put our dry traditional mead on oak staves to add a barrel aged character.  Strong honey on the nose gives way to caramel flavors and woody tones.  Oak rounds out the dry finish.  Honey Oak complements anything on the grill.  Goes nicely with conversation at the bar.

style.name: Dry Mead

The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Brothers Drake Meadery
breweries.description:
Like most things, there are various ways to make mead. At Brothers Drake, our philosophy on making mead is based on the following principles:

1. Start Local: We buy local honey, support local agriculture, and produce a local product.

2. Use the Best: We look for the highest quality local product on the market, ordering from the best from the source closest to Ohio.

3. No Heat: We do not boil our honey or any water used in production. The No Heat Method keeps honey flavors true to the source and a better mead.

4. No Added Sulfites: Unlike grapes which have wild yeast growing on them, honey is naturally antiseptic and antibiotic, so no sulfites needed.

5. Build community: We share our knowledge openly and are grateful to people everywhere who ask questions, share their perspective, and engage in an open collaborative dialogue on mead-making.

6. Embrace creativity: Our mead can be paired with wonderful cheeses, appetizers, and entrees, as well as used in cooking and in mixed drinks.

These basic principles guide our craft, our partnerships, and our practices. We look forward to sharing a drink with you!

data.name: Honey Sun Mead - African Birds Eye Chili
data.nameDisplay: Honey Sun Mead - African Birds Eye Chili
data.description: This mead is somewhat of a shock to the senses. African Birds Eye Chilli or Habanero Chilli lends an interesting wooded nose to the mead, which is entirely overwhelmed by the first sip, which clears the sinuses in a way similar to that of eating half a cup of Wassabi with a sushi roll. This mead is best served as an ice breaker at dinner parties, especially if the food will be hot. It is also quite amusing later on in a dinner party to circulate a bottle of Chilli mead when some of the guests become competitive.

breweries.name: Makana Meadery
breweries.description:
Grahamstown Brewery Pty (Ltd), trading as Makana Meadery was founded in the year 2000 with the primary objective of placing a 20 000 year old South African honey based beverage, iQhilika on the world's shelves.

Makana Meadery has its beginnings in a Rhodes University based research project to develop state of the art fermentation technology for producing iQhilika, an African mead. The meadery is housed in a historical Grahamstown landmark on the outskirts of this picturesque educational town in the Eastern Cape of South Africa.

data.name: Honey Sun Mead - Dry
data.description: This mead is enjoyed by those who have learned the subtleties of mead and can savour the extremely discreet honey notes and pleasant almond aftertaste. Best served chilled with game, red meats and curries. A sociable after dinner drink that will assist the consumer in solving the worlds problems (in theory)!

data.name: Honey Sun Mead - Herbal
data.description:
A semi sweet mead with rooibos, honeybush tea, cinnamon and apple. The herbs provide a smooth structure to the mead with a lingering honey aftertaste. Ideally served at 12-14 degrees Celsius, in a large red wine glass to allow development of the nose.

A good stand alone sundowner, a well matched partner to spicy dishes and stir fries, game and poultry and a companion to desserts and coffees.

breweries.name: Redstone Meadery
breweries.description:
David Myers, known as 'Chairman of the Mead', founder of Redstone Meadery, is a romantic and wants to see mead once again enjoying the glory days of yesteryear. He started the Boulder, Colorado company with the 'natural philosophy' that he produce the highest quality honey wine on the market.

Because of this 'philosophy of mead', Redstone does not cork (to avoid oxidation) but instead uses swing top bottles. This ensures the mead will not breathe while cellaring plus offers a much longer shelf life once the bottle has been opened.

In keeping with the 'natural' approach, Redstone does not add any sulfites, a known allergen, as honey is it's own natural preservative. Redstone only pasteurizes the must (unfermented mead) and never boils. The company strives to feature the flavors of the fermentable as much as possible.

In 2003 Redstone Meadery brought the International Mead Festival (www.meadfest.com) to Boulder, Colorado and with that helped to establish mead as its own beverage category. Also at this time Redstone spearheaded the creation of the International Mead Association (www.meadfest.org) to help promote and educate the masses about the world's first fermented beverage.

Currently, Redstone products are distributed to 20 states across the U.S., making it the widest distributed wine from the state of Colorado and one of the most widely distributed meads in the country! From the Northwest to the Southeast, Ask for Mead!

data.name: Kickin' Cranberry Orange Mead
data.description: Our mead with Peppers! This wine has the juicy flavors of Cranberry and Orange, kicked up a notch with local, jalapeno peppers from Granite Springs Farm in Pittsboro. This mead has a great smokey nose and starts out fruity, then moves to smokey with a little bit of heat! Serve slightly chilled with everything from backed chicken to a BLT, to shrimp and grits!

breweries.name: Starrlight Mead
breweries.description:
After several years as home mead makers, we are thrilled to be opening Starrlight Mead. We have had a fantastic time making mead and meeting mead drinkers from all over the world, and now its our turn to share our love of mead with all of you!

Becky Starr, Owner, Sales/Tasting Room Manager
Ben Starr, Owner, Wine/Meadmaker

We first discovered mead in CA at the Southern California Renaissance Pleasure Faire. Several years later, we found friends that were home brewing mead with good results. We decided to try our hand at it too.

In February 2006, we entered our first competition and took Best in Show out of over 210 entries in the home mead-maker category at the International Mead Association’s Mead Festival. The competition was judged by seven professionals in the mead industry; including Ken Schramm, author of The Compleat Mead Maker, and meadery owners from around the world. The Best in Show prize was selected from the gold medal winners in nine categories. Our “Starrlight Mulled Apple Cyser” was awarded not only the gold medal in the cyser (mead made with apples) category, but was also selected as the best overall representation of mead making. It was at that point we decided to try creating a business from our love of mead.

Ben shares his expertise and love of brewing by conducting demonstrations and workshops on mead making in the local community. We also organize and conduct the local Mead Day celebration each August (since 2005) and are a key part of the product tasting team for mead reviews on Gotmead.com. Becky worked with Chatham Hill Winery for 2 years learning tasting room and wine club management. We are members of the Chatham County Beekeepers Association, and the NC Winegrowers Association.

data.name: Meadjitos
data.description: A Cuban classic goes medieval! Our crisp, fresh take on a summer favorite drink, Meadjitos (mead-hee-toes), is a wonderful balance of spearmint, lime and honey in a semi-sweet mead! Elegant, yet fun, for entertaining or casual drinking by the pool! Try it frozen too!

data.name: Miel de Garde
data.description: A traditional mead made with orange blossom honey. Aged for 18 months in oak barrels. For the first release in our Miel de Garde line, we used the highest quality orange blossom honey available, then aged it in a neutral American oak barrel for 18 months. The result is a bright aromatic, decadent mead made for sipping. Serve at cellar temperature.

breweries.name: B. Nektar Meadery
breweries.description:
Known for the most amazing and creative alcoholic beverages made from honey. B. Nektar is a world-wide sensation.

To boldly go where no meadery has gone before. To prove to you that the horrible mead your best friend made one time in college is NOT what a good mead should taste like. To show you that mead doesn't HAVE to be sweet. To educate you on the different styles of mead. To bring mead into the mainstream, but still maintain our integrity. To everyday thank my mom and tell her that I love her (shouldn't we all?).

data.name: Mõdu
data.description: Mõdu on kõikide kääritatud jookide kuningas, traditsioon, mille juured pärinevad iidsete jumalate ning suurte kuningate aegadest. Sajandeid tagasi oli tõeline mõdu lihtrahvale kättesaamatu ülikute nauding, kuid nüüd on ta täies uhkuses Teie ees. Saku Mõdu- õige mõdus jook.

breweries.name: Saku Õlletehas
breweries.description:
The brewing traditions of Saku Brewery reach back to the beginning of the 19th century. Then the Saku estate was owned by count Karl Friedrich Rehbinder who built a distillery and a brewery on his estate. The brewery was first documented in October 1820. It is believed that the production of beer, for the purpose of sale to pubs and taverns begun during the autumn of that year. From the end of 19th century onward Saku has remained among the leading breweries in Estonia.
In 1991 joint venture Saku Õlletehas was established. Since January 27, 1998 the shares of Saku Brewery were traded in the list on the Tallinn Stock Exchange. On September 20, 2008, the shares of Saku Õlletehase AS were delisted from Tallinn Stock Exchange. Today 100% of the shares are owned by Carlsberg Breweries.
Through large investments, Saku Brewery has become the market leader on the Estonian beer market. According to market research by ACNielsen in March 2009, Saku Brewery held 38,7% of the local market share. The total sales of beer by Saku amounted to 59 million litres in 2007.
Beverages of Saku Brewery are exported amongst other countries to Sweden (the only Estonian beer in the Systembolaget is Saku Kuld), Finland, Netherlands, England, Germany, Ireland and Canada. Saku's exports during the first five months of 2009 amounted to 3,12 million litres.

data.name: Moon Dance
data.description: California Riesling grape notes are light but to the fore with a surprisingly drier than usual style finish. Nuance of French Oak medium char from the barrel adds intriguing interest without overpowering. Delicately plays the nuanced honey note well with the grape swirl and toast notes. This one will make you want to dance in the moonlight.

style.name: Dry Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a dry white wine, with a pleasant mixture of subtle honey character, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Moonlight Meadery
breweries.description:
It all started back in 1995, when Michael tried a cyser (apple and honey mead) for the first time.  Since that first sip Michael has developed a passion, and a masterful skill at making international award winning meads. Michael Fairbrother has started Moonlight Meadery™, with a mission to bring ultra premium meads to the market place.  It is more than a product and it is more than a process, it's our obsession.

"Mead to me is passion, it's about living and love, it's about enjoyment, family and friends, and sharing." says Michael Fairbrother, Founder and Mead Maker. 

Our meads will be unique, and unlike anything you have ever tried, you will find it incredible!   We are going to embrace the unique nature of natural honey as minimally processed as possible.

data.name: Off-Dry Traditional
data.description: Honey wine with just a hint of sweetness. Light floral notes with a slight citrus finish. Serve as you would a white wine, lightly chilled with Lemon Chicken, fish, or with spicy food! Bronze Medal winner at 2012 Mazer Cup International mead-only competition!
data.foodPairings: Lemon Chicken, fish, or with spicy food

style.name: Dry Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a dry white wine, with a pleasant mixture of subtle honey character, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Starrlight Mead
breweries.description:
After several years as home mead makers, we are thrilled to be opening Starrlight Mead. We have had a fantastic time making mead and meeting mead drinkers from all over the world, and now its our turn to share our love of mead with all of you!

Becky Starr, Owner, Sales/Tasting Room Manager
Ben Starr, Owner, Wine/Meadmaker

We first discovered mead in CA at the Southern California Renaissance Pleasure Faire. Several years later, we found friends that were home brewing mead with good results. We decided to try our hand at it too.

In February 2006, we entered our first competition and took Best in Show out of over 210 entries in the home mead-maker category at the International Mead Association’s Mead Festival. The competition was judged by seven professionals in the mead industry; including Ken Schramm, author of The Compleat Mead Maker, and meadery owners from around the world. The Best in Show prize was selected from the gold medal winners in nine categories. Our “Starrlight Mulled Apple Cyser” was awarded not only the gold medal in the cyser (mead made with apples) category, but was also selected as the best overall representation of mead making. It was at that point we decided to try creating a business from our love of mead.

Ben shares his expertise and love of brewing by conducting demonstrations and workshops on mead making in the local community. We also organize and conduct the local Mead Day celebration each August (since 2005) and are a key part of the product tasting team for mead reviews on Gotmead.com. Becky worked with Chatham Hill Winery for 2 years learning tasting room and wine club management. We are members of the Chatham County Beekeepers Association, and the NC Winegrowers Association.

data.name: Pillow Talk
data.description: Our ‘winding down after a long day’s work’ mead. Lavender and Chamomile metheglin is our answer to aromatherapy. And perhaps an excuse to get a little more ‘local’ with that certain someone…

style.name: Dry Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a dry white wine, with a pleasant mixture of subtle honey character, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. breweries.name: Brothers Drake Meadery
breweries.description:
Like most things, there are various ways to make mead. At Brothers Drake, our philosophy on making mead is based on the following principles:

1. Start Local: We buy local honey, support local agriculture, and produce a local product.

2. Use the Best: We look for the highest quality local product on the market, ordering from the best from the source closest to Ohio.

3. No Heat: We do not boil our honey or any water used in production. The No Heat Method keeps honey flavors true to the source and a better mead.

4. No Added Sulfites: Unlike grapes which have wild yeast growing on them, honey is naturally antiseptic and antibiotic, so no sulfites needed.

5. Build community: We share our knowledge openly and are grateful to people everywhere who ask questions, share their perspective, and engage in an open collaborative dialogue on mead-making.

6. Embrace creativity: Our mead can be paired with wonderful cheeses, appetizers, and entrees, as well as used in cooking and in mixed drinks.

These basic principles guide our craft, our partnerships, and our practices. We look forward to sharing a drink with you!

data.name: Sage Traditional
data.description: Sage traditional mead is our driest offering. Made from the rare black button sage honey, this mead is earthy, deep, and complex, with hints of almond, oak, and French toast. 2014 Mazer Cup International Silver Medal winner.

breweries.name: Moonlight Meadery
breweries.description:
It all started back in 1995, when Michael tried a cyser (apple and honey mead) for the first time.  Since that first sip Michael has developed a passion, and a masterful skill at making international award winning meads. Michael Fairbrother has started Moonlight Meadery™, with a mission to bring ultra premium meads to the market place.  It is more than a product and it is more than a process, it's our obsession.

"Mead to me is passion, it's about living and love, it's about enjoyment, family and friends, and sharing." says Michael Fairbrother, Founder and Mead Maker. 

Our meads will be unique, and unlike anything you have ever tried, you will find it incredible!   We are going to embrace the unique nature of natural honey as minimally processed as possible.
